comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: She was an actress who died in the influenza epidemic of 1919.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She appears to have been famous for her striking sense of fashion--do a google image search to see more examples. And her wikipedia entry indicates a flair for other kinds of artifice as well... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaby_Deslys Other tidbits--she died in part because she refused to allow surgeons to operate freely on her severely infected throat, for fear they'd leave scars; and her deathbed was purchased as a prop for Hollywood films, and appears in "Sunset Boulevard" as Norma Desmond's bed.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Parisian, she came to New York in November 1913, but she might have been in the news because in 1910 she had been a flame of King Manuel -- who was married on September 4, 1913. See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4332823938/ According to Wikipedia, he gave her some very expensive pearls.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: What a character! According to the Internet Movie Database, Gaby was born in Marseilles in 1881, and died in Paris in 1920.  Thanks to all of you for providing such great trivia.   Try searching by her full name in the Prints & Photographs Online Catalog to see more great photos of Gaby in some of her outfits.
